In New York City, plans are underway for the develop¬
ment of an educational experiment at the Elementary
School level, with a device known as the Talking
Typewriter. This instrument affords us the opportunity
to test the concept of "Responsive Environment" in
a controlled way. In a New York Times article,
(Oct. 28, 1966) this technique is described in
the following way: "When a child touches a key,
the machine not only prints a letter, but pro¬
nounces the letter, figure or symbol. Later the
machine displays and pronounces letters for the
pupil to type, and progresses to words and sentences."
Television has been included as part of this ex¬
periment, so that hopefully, that experience can
be replicated in other geographical areas, shared
with other people working in similar areas of concern.
